gitlens.description: Supercharge Git within VS Code — Visualize code authorship at a glance via Git blame annotations and CodeLens, seamlessly navigate and explore Git repositories, gain valuable insights via rich visualizations and powerful comparison commands, and so much more
config.gitlens.currentLine.enabled: Specifies whether to provide a blame annotation for the current line, by default. Use the `Toggle Line Blame Annotations` command (`gitlens.toggleLineBlame`) to toggle the annotations on and off for the current window
config.gitlens.codeLens.enabled: Specifies whether to provide any Git CodeLens, by default. Use the `Toggle Git CodeLens` command (`gitlens.toggleCodeLens`) to toggle the Git CodeLens on and off for the current window

home.welcome.title: Welcome to GitLens 12
home.welcome.description: GitLens supercharges Git inside VS Code and unlocks the untapped knowledge within each repository. It helps you to visualize code authorship at a glance via Git blame annotations and CodeLens, seamlessly navigate and explore Git repositories, gain valuable insights via rich visualizations and powerful comparison commands, and so much more.
home.welcome.setupDescription: Use the quick setup experience to personalize GitLens to meet your needs, or jump over to the getting started walkthrough to familiarize yourself with the rich features GitLens provides.
welcome.title: Welcome to GitLens
welcome.powerfulBlurb: GitLens is powerful, feature rich, and highly customizable to meet your needs. Do you find CodeLens intrusive or the current line blame annotation distracting — no problem, quickly turn them off or change how they behave using the options below.
welcome.currentLineBlameHint: Adds an unobtrusive blame annotation at the end of the current line
welcome.codeLensHint: Adds authorship CodeLens to the top of files and on code blocks
welcome.statusBarBlameHint: Adds a Git blame annotation about the current line to the status bar
welcome.viewsBlurb: GitLens views can be configured to be shown in different side bar layouts to best match your workflow
welcome.viewsSourceControlHint: Shows all the views together on the Source Control side bar
welcome.viewsGitLensHint: Shows all the views together on the GitLens side bar
welcome.viewsCustomHint: You can also simply drag & drop individual views to create custom layouts
welcome.datesRelativeHint: Shows some dates relatively, e.g. 1 day ago
welcome.dateLocaleHint: Use system for the system locale, or a locale language tag, e.g. en-US
welcome.dateFormatPlaceholder: defaults to MMMM Do, YYYY h:mma
home.preview.visualFileHistoryDescriptio: The Visual File History allows you to quickly see the evolution of a file, including when changes were made, how large they were, and who made them.
home.preview.worktreesDescription: Worktrees allow you to easily work on different branches of a repository simultaneously.
walkthrough.welcome.title: Get Started with GitLens
walkthrough.welcome.description: Discover and personalize features that supercharge your Git experience
walkthrough.welcome.experience.title: Get setup quickly
walkthrough.welcome.experience.descripti:
Use the Quick Setup to easily configure frequently used GitLens features.

[Open Quick Setup](command:gitlens.showWelcomePage?%22quick-setup%22 "Opens the GitLens Quick Setup")
walkthrough.welcome.settings.title: Easily customize every aspect of GitLens
walkthrough.welcome.settings.description:
A rich, interactive settings editor enables seemingly endless customization possibilities.

[Open Settings](command:gitlens.showSettingsPage "Opens the GitLens Interactive Settings")
walkthrough.welcome.currentLineBlame.tit: See who made what changes at a glance
walkthrough.welcome.currentLineBlame.des: Current line and status bar blame provide historical context about line changes.
walkthrough.welcome.gitCodeLens.title: View Git authorship via CodeLens
walkthrough.welcome.gitCodeLens.descript: CodeLens adds contextual authorship information and links at the top of each file and at the beginning of each block of code.
walkthrough.welcome.revisionHistory.desc: Use the Commits and File History views to see how code has evolved over time.
walkthrough.welcome.fileAnnotations.titl: See more context with file annotations
walkthrough.welcome.fileAnnotations.desc: Whole file annotations place visual indicators in the gutter and scroll bar that provide additional context about changes.
walkthrough.welcome.gitSideBarViews.titl: Explore repositories from the side bar
walkthrough.welcome.gitSideBarViews.desc:
Rich views expose even more Git functionality in your side bar.

[Set Views Layout](command:gitlens.setViewsLayout)
walkthrough.welcome.hostingServiceIntegr: Quickly gain insights from pull requests and issues without leaving your editor.
walkthrough.welcome.gitCommandPalette.ti: Work faster with Git Command Palette
walkthrough.welcome.gitCommandPalette.de:
Now you don't have to remember all those Git commands.

[Open Git Command Palette](command:gitlens.gitCommands)
walkthrough.welcome.interactiveRebaseEdi: A user-friendly interactive rebase editor to easily configure an interactive rebase session
walkthrough.welcome.terminal.title: Jump to git details from the terminal
walkthrough.welcome.terminal.description: Using ctrl/cmd+click on autolinks in the integrated terminal will quickly jump to more details for commits, branches, tags, and more.
settings.statusBar.label: Status Bar Blame
settings.statusBar.hint: Adds a Git blame annotation about the current line to the status bar
Show the Pull Request (if any) that introduced the commit
Requires a connection to a supported remote service (e.g. GitHub)
settings.statusBar.format.label: Annotation format
settings.statusBar.alignment.label: Position the annotation on the
settings.statusBar.command.label: When clicked
settings.statusBar.reduceFlicker.label: Reduce flashing when updating the annotation
settings.statusBar.reduceFlicker.hint: Avoids clearing the previous blame information when changing lines to reduce status bar "flashing"
settings.hovers.label: Hovers
settings.hovers.hint: Adds detailed blame information accessible via hovers
settings.hovers.avatars.label: Use author avatars
settings.hovers.pullRequests.enabled.lab: Show the Pull Request (if any) that introduced the commit
settings.hovers.pullRequests.enabled.hin: Requires a connection to a supported remote service (e.g. GitHub)

settings.hovers.currentLine.over.label: Shown when over the
settings.hovers.details.label: Add blame details
settings.hovers.changes.label: Add changes (diff)
settings.command.toggleFileChanges: toggles the file changes since before the commit
settings.command.toggleFileChangesOnly: toggles the file changes from the commit
settings.command.diffWithPrevious: opens line changes with the previous revision
settings.command.diffWithWorking: opens line changes with the working file
settings.command.revealCommitInView: reveals the commit in the Side Bar
settings.command.showQuickCommitFileDeta: shows file details of the commit
settings.command.openCommitOnRemote: opens the commit on the remote service (when available)
settings.command.copyRemoteCommitUrl: copies the remote commit url to the clipboard (when available)
settings.command.openFileOnRemote: opens the file revision on the remote service (when available)
settings.command.copyRemoteFileUrl: copies the remote file revision url to the clipboard (when available)
settings.currentLine.label: Current Line Blame
settings.currentLine.hint: Adds an unobtrusive blame annotation at the end of the current line
settings.currentLine.scrollable.label: Include the annotation when scrolling the editor horizontally
settings.currentLine.scrollable.hint1: When enabled the annotation can be scrolled into view when it is outside the viewport.
settings.currentLine.scrollable.hint2.pa: Setting this to false will inhibit the hovers from showing over the annotation; Set
to line to enable the hovers to show anywhere over the line.
settings.currentLine.header.info: Use the GitLens: Toggle Line Blame Annotations command to override this setting for the current window
settings.currentLine.pullRequests.enable: Show the Pull Request (if any) that introduced the commit
Requires a connection to a supported remote service (e.g. GitHub)
settings.currentLine.format.label: Annotation format
settings.header.title: Settings
settings.header.advancedCustomizations.p: For advanced customizations, refer to the
settings.codeLens.label: Git CodeLens
settings.codeLens.hint: Adds authorship CodeLens to the top of files and on code blocks

settings.codeLens.recentChange.label: Add the author and date of the most recent change for the file or code block
settings.codeLens.authors.label: Add the number of authors and the most prominent author of the file or code block
settings.codeLens.scopes.label: Add CodeLens to the following scopes
settings.codeLens.scopes.file.label: File scope
settings.codeLens.scopes.file.hint: At the top of the file

settings.codeLens.scopes.blocks.label: Block scope
settings.codeLens.scopes.blocks.hint: At the start of functions, methods, etc
settings.views.label: Views
settings.views.hint: Adds rich views to visualize, navigate, and explore
settings.views.blurb: GitLens views can be configured to be shown in different side bar layouts to best match your workflow
settings.views.layout.scm.label: Source Control Layout (default)
settings.views.layout.scm.hint: Shows all the views together on the Source Control side bar
settings.views.layout.gitlens.label: GitLens Layout
settings.views.layout.gitlens.hint: Shows all the views together on the GitLens side bar
settings.views.layout.customHint: You can also simply drag & drop individual views to create custom layouts
settings.views.commits.label: Commits view
settings.views.commits.hint: Adds a %{settings.views.commits.label}% to visualize, explore, and manage Git commits

settings.views.repositories.sections.lab: Show the following sections under each repository
settings.views.repositories.pullRequests: Show the pull request associated with each branch
Show the pull request that introduced each commit
Automatically refresh when a repository or the file system changes
settings.views.repositories.autoReveal.l: Automatically reveal repository when opening files
settings.views.common.files.layout.label: Layout files
Chooses the best layout based on the number of files at each nesting level
settings.views.common.files.compact.hint: Compacts (flattens) unnecessary nesting when using a tree layouts
settings.views.common.avatars.label: Use author avatars

settings.dates.defaultDateStyle.hint.rel: Shows some dates relatively, e.g. 1 day ago
settings.dates.defaultDateLocale.label: Date locale

settings.dates.defaultDateFormat.label: Date format
settings.dates.defaultDateFormat.placeho: defaults to MMMM Do, YYYY h:mma
settings.dates.learnMore.format.title: See Moment.js docs for supported date formats
settings.dates.defaultTimeFormat.label: Time format

settings.modes.hint: Supports user-defined modes for quickly toggling between sets of settings
settings.modes.info.switch: Use the GitLens: Switch Mode command to quickly switch the active mode

settings.heatmap.hint: Adds on-demand heatmap (age) indicator to the edge of the gutter to show how recently lines were changed

settings.views.fileHistory.hint: Adds a File History view to visualize, navigate, and explore the revision history of the current file, a specified file or folder, or just the selected lines of the current file
settings.views.lineHistory.title: Line History view
settings.views.lineHistory.hint: Adds a Line History view, hidden by default, to visualize, navigate, and explore the revision history of the selected lines of current file

views.searchAndCompare.welcome.compareRe:
Compare a <branch, tag, or ref> with another <branch, tag, or ref>

[Compare References...](command:gitlens.views.searchAndCompare.selectForCompare)
views.worktrees.welcome.content: Worktrees allow you to easily work on different branches of a repository simultaneously. You can create multiple working trees, each of which can be opened in individual windows or all together in a single workspace.
views.title: GitLens
